author: kolbyml
content: <@543900561460822016> you said in chat you are looking seriously into EIP-4444's for Geth, which solutions do you envision Geth supporting?

author: robocopsgonemad
content: so execution layer consolidations for MaxEB are going to be in devnet1, or did i mishear?

author: timbeiko
content:
**ACDE Recap** 
- devnet-1: still a WIP from all teams, but we can optimstically get a version up by next ACDC with a subset of EL/CLs! note that the spec **does** include EL-triggered withdrawals and leaves 7702 as per the latest **merged** commit (https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/pectra-devnet-1)
- for 7702, <@543900561460822016> opened a draft PR which proposes a different delegation/revocation design: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8677, teams should review this, and we'll organize another 7702 breakout before the next ACDE (poll for time in next post!)
- EOF devnets will be built on top of Prague, teams should rebase. Various implementation stages being tracked here (https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/blob/main/spec/implementation_matrix.md), and Erigon said it would be nice to have some EOF blocks to test with soon
- PeerDAS devnets will be based on CL spec `v1.5.0-alpha.3`, expected to launch in the next few weeks
- I proposed a template for `discussions-to` threads on EthMag (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/template-for-discussion-to-threads/20347), if teams have suggestions on it, please share, otherwise, we'll get it added üîú 
- Pari is looking for EL admins for the `eth-clients` repo, see the thread above for context ( https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/745077610685661265/1253284105358147648) 
- Next ACDE is happening as scheduled on July 4th, but <@539495253418180618> will be running it. Have fun üòÑ !

author: kolbyml
content: Piper made a message here <https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/688075293562503241/1247578868101943326> to my knowledge Nethermind, Besu, EthereumJS, Nimbus EL are looking seriously into using Portal History for EIP-4444. gakonst from Reth asked me if I would be interested in "owning it" for them but I am currently busy executing all of the blocks to keep up with the head of the chain for `trin-execution`, which is a byproduct of our work to support the Portal State network which will store all the Archival State initially*.

author: matt.nelson
content: We still have 7212 in CFI status (secp256r1). Do any teams still have an apetite to ship this in light of an already huge scope? Or let rollups lead the implementations. My only concern is a fragmented wallet ecosystem from L1 --> L2 if we differ, as RIP-7212 is seeing support and implementations on L1

author: rjected
content: the same code is used for op-reth fjord

author: matt.nelson
content: we have the code as well - the question i suppose is around more precompiles to support and usage on L1.

author: rjected
content: I guess, I don't have a good view of the steelman for "why not"
